title: The number of connected nodes continues to decrease
body:
I am deploying a complete test chain, with 50+ groups of nodes, the nodes are divided into two clusters, and each server has an independent IP, and each node is connected through the public network ip. The entire chain has been running continuously for some time, but encountered a problem,
When the node starts running or restarts, the number of connections is around 40-50. It will gradually decrease later, and even some nodes restart the number of connections is 0

### Replenish
With the same configuration, the internal network can run stably

### Relevant ports have been opened
tcp 13000
udp 12000

### Use lighthouse as bootnode
```
#!/usr/bin/env bash
/mnt/md0/testnet/bootnodes/public/lighthouse boot_node \
--testnet-dir /mnt/md0/testnet/bootnodes/public/config \
--port 4242 \
--listen-address 0.0.0.0 \
--disable-packet-filter \
--network-dir /mnt/md0/testnet/bootnodes/public/config/bootnode >> /mnt/md0/testnet/bootnodes/public/logs/bootnode.log 2>&1
```

### test query

`ansible all -m shell -b -a "curl http://127.0.0.1:3500/eth/v1/node/peer_count"`

```
--rpc-port=4000 \

```
Since the connection ip is always switched between the internal network and the external network, I added --p2p-denylist="private"
My guess is that the specified external network has failed, and the internal network connection is automatically switched to.
